item.title: Fly tipping next to community bins near gallon close, 14th July
item.description:
Fly tipping outside of communal bins behind galleon close . large items of furniture, mattresses, create and other rubbish. This has been ignored from the last report that was made on the same issue and same fly tipping on 03/07/25 . One hour after I reported the issue the case was close reporting that the issue was resolved. Now the rubbish has over piled onto the foot path making it harder for buggies and those less able/ unable to walk to get around .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Galleon Close, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard Dislodged and Removed – Urgent Attention Needed, 14th July
item.description:
The bollard at the corner of Powis Street and Mortgramit Square has been knocked over by a car on the 1st of July 2025. In the following days, someone attempted to steal it and dragged it along the pavement. It is now lying next to a bin on Macbean Street (near the junction with Powis Street, outside Iceland). We tried to move the bollard back ourselves, but it is extremely heavy. Could you arrange for it to be retrieved and reinstalled? At the moment, with no bollard in place, cars are driving onto the pavement and parking there, which also raises concerns about vehicles reversing into nearby buildings. We would greatly appreciate your prompt attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mortgramit Square, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazards loose kerb stones and pot holes, 14th July
item.description:
